risks.name: AMD19hFirmware
risks.message: Nodes with AMD 19h family CPUs  (Bergamo, Milan, etc.) can fail to boot after applying operating system updates.

promql.promql: topk(1, group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id="",vendor="AuthenticAMD",family="25"}) or 0 * group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id=""}) )

risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

risks.name: AROSystemDLooping
risks.message: ARO clusters created on 4.12.z and below are experiencing a bug where systemd detects a dependency loop. Systemd deletes these dependencies causing kubelet and crio to never start on nodes.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  label_replace(group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version=~"4[.]([0-9]|1[0-2])[.].*"}),"born_by_4_12", "yes, born in 4.12 or earlier", "", "")
  or
  label_replace(0 * group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version!~"4[.]([0-9]|1[0-2])[.].*"}),"born_by_4_12", "no, born in 4.13 or later", "", "")
) 
* on () group_left (name)
topk(1,
  group by (name) (cluster_operator_conditions{_id="",name="aro"})
  or
  0 * topk(1, group by (name) (cluster_operator_conditions{_id=""}))
)

risks.name: AzureSystemDLooping
risks.message: Azure clusters created on 4.(y<12) or 4.12.(z<54) are experiencing a bug where systemd detects a dependency loop. Systemd deletes these dependencies causing CRI-O and the kublet to never start on nodes.

promql.promql:
(
  label_replace(group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version=~"4[.](([0-9]|1[01])[.][0-9]*|12[.]([1-4]?[0-9]|5[0-3]))"}),"born_before_4_12_54", "yes, born in 4.11 or 4.12.53 or earlier", "", "")
  or on ()
  label_replace(0 * group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version!~"4[.](([0-9]|1[01])[.][0-9]*|12[.]([1-4]?[0-9]|5[0-3]))"}),"born_before_4_12_54", "no, born in 4.12.54 or 4.13 or later", "", "")
)
* on () group_left (type)
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="Azure"})
  or on ()
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

promql.promql: topk(1, group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id="",vendor="AuthenticAMD",family="25"}) or 0 * group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id=""}) )

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: ARODNSWrongBootSequence
risks.message: Disconnected ARO clusters or clusters with a UDR 0.0.0.0/0 route definition that are blocking the ARO ACR and quay, are not be able to add or replace nodes after an upgrade

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: ARODNSWrongBootSequence
risks.message: Disconnected ARO clusters or clusters with a UDR 0.0.0.0/0 route definition that are blocking the ARO ACR and quay, are not be able to add or replace nodes after an upgrade

risks.name: AcceleratedNetworkingRace
risks.message: Adding a new worker node may fail for clusters running on Azure with Accelerated Networking.

risks.name: AcceleratedNetworkingRace
risks.message: Adding a new worker node may fail for clusters running on Azure with Accelerated Networking.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

risks.name: PerformanceProfilesCPUQuota
risks.message: Pods may not execute properly because of CPU quota issues on clusters using PerformanceProfiles.

risks.name: PersistentVolumeDiskIDSymlinks
risks.message: New PersistentVolumes are created bound to an invalid symlink instead of the correct one and thus fail once updated to 4.13.4 or later as the invalid symlink dispears.

risks.name: StrictPodSecurityViolation
risks.message: OCP 4.13 prereleases attempted to enforce PodSecurityViolations, but ended up backing off.  Clusters with violating workloads should either fix their workloads, or avoid updating to 4.13 until that softening lands.

risks.name: ConsoleAvailableUpdatesNull
risks.message: An administrator console regression breaks the cluster settings page when 'availableUpdates' is null and 'Upgradeable' is 'False'.  You can still use 'oc adm upgrade', address the 'Upgradeable' issues, or wait for a fixed release.

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: OVNKubeMasterDSPrestop
risks.message: Upgrades can get stuck on OVN clusters that were installed as 4.10 or earlier.

promql.promql: topk(1, label_replace(group(cluster_version{type="initial",version=~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "yes, born in 4.10 or earlier", "", "") or label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{type="initial",version!~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "no, born in 4.11 or later", "", "") ) * on () group_left(resource) ( group by (resource) (max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="egressips.k8s.ovn.org"}[1h])) or on () 0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h])) )

risks.name: AROBrokenDNSMasq
risks.message: Adding a new worker node will fail for clusters running on ARO.

risks.name: ARODNSWrongBootSequence
risks.message: Disconnected ARO clusters or clusters with a UDR 0.0.0.0/0 route definition that are blocking the ARO ACR and quay, are not be able to add or replace nodes after an upgrade

risks.name: AcceleratedNetworkingRace
risks.message: Adding a new worker node may fail for clusters running on Azure with Accelerated Networking.

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: AcceleratedNetworkingRace
risks.message: Adding a new worker node may fail for clusters running on Azure with Accelerated Networking.

risks.name: ConsoleAvailableUpdatesNull
risks.message: An administrator console regression breaks the cluster settings page when 'availableUpdates' is null and 'Upgradeable' is 'False'.  You can still use 'oc adm upgrade', address the 'Upgradeable' issues, or wait for a fixed release.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

risks.name: PerformanceProfilesCPUQuota
risks.message: Pods may not execute properly because of CPU quota issues on clusters using PerformanceProfiles.

risks.name: PersistentVolumeDiskIDSymlinks
risks.message: New PersistentVolumes are created bound to an invalid symlink instead of the correct one and thus fail once updated to 4.13.4 or later as the invalid symlink dispears.

risks.name: StrictPodSecurityViolation
risks.message: OCP 4.13 prereleases attempted to enforce PodSecurityViolations, but ended up backing off.  Clusters with violating workloads should either fix their workloads, or avoid updating to 4.13 until that softening lands.

risks.name: PatchesOlderRelease
risks.message: The 4.12.12 release only resolves an installation issue https://issues.redhat.com//browse/OCPBUGS-11662 , which does not affect already running clusters. 4.12.12 does not include fixes delivered in recent 4.11.z and 4.12.z releases and therefore upgrading from these versions would cause fixed bugs to reappear. Red Hat does not recommend upgrading clusters to 4.12.12 version for this reason.

risks.name: ConsoleAvailableUpdatesNull
risks.message: An administrator console regression breaks the cluster settings page when 'availableUpdates' is null and 'Upgradeable' is 'False'.  You can still use 'oc adm upgrade', address the 'Upgradeable' issues, or wait for a fixed release.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

risks.name: AcceleratedNetworkingRace
risks.message: Adding a new worker node may fail for clusters running on Azure with Accelerated Networking.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

risks.name: PerformanceProfilesCPUQuota
risks.message: Pods may not execute properly because of CPU quota issues on clusters using PerformanceProfiles.

risks.name: PersistentVolumeDiskIDSymlinks
risks.message: New PersistentVolumes are created bound to an invalid symlink instead of the correct one and thus fail once updated to 4.13.4 or later as the invalid symlink dispears.

risks.name: SeccompFilterErrno524
risks.message: Pods scheduled to nodes running a RHCOS/kernel version with a known defect may fail to start with a CreateContainerError.

risks.name: AWSMintModeWithoutCredentials
risks.message: AWS clusters in Mint mode where the Secret with AWS credentials has been removed are not able to finish update.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (mode) (cco_credentials_mode{mode="mint"})
  or
  0 * group by (mode) (cco_credentials_mode)
)
* on () group_left (type)
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider)
)
* on () group_left (secret)
bottomk(1,
  0 * group by (secret) (kube_secret_info{namespace="kube-system",secret="aws-creds"})
  or
  group(kube_secret_info)
)

risks.message: Pods scheduled to nodes running a RHCOS/kernel version with a known defect may fail to start with a CreateContainerError.
